db_helper#

1. insert_new_sample#

db_helper.insert_new_sample(qr_code_key, sample_obj)#

This function is invoked after we have checked that the entry is unique to the db.

Parameters

  • qr_code_key (str) – The unique identifier for each sample entry.

  • sample_obj (dic) – Dictionary with key value pairs of the fields of the sample: (experiment_id ,storage_condition, analyst, expiration_date, date_entered, contents)

Returns

Response object to send to send to frontend

Return type

flask.response

2. update_sample_by_qr_code_key#

db_helper.update_sample_by_qr_code_key(qr_code_key, sample_obj)#

These function is invoked when the user tries to create a new entry but an existing entry already exists.

Parameters

  • qr_code_key (str) – The unique identifier for each sample entry.

  • sample_obj (dic) – Dictionary with key value pairs of the fields of the sample: (experiment_id ,storage_condition, analyst, expiration_date, date_entered, contents)

  • mimetype ('application/json' or other mime type.) – Optional mimetype that defaults to type JSON.

Returns

Response object to send to the frontend

Return type

flask.response

3. retrieve_sample_information_with_key#

db_helper.retrieve_sample_information_with_key(qr_code_key)#

Retrieves from the database using the qr_code_key provided to us.

Parameters

qr_code_key (str) – The unique identifier for each sample entry.

Returns

Tuple with row entry in database

Return type

tuple

4. check_if_key_exists#

db_helper.check_if_key_exists(qr_code_key)#

Given the qr_code_key we check if a row with this key exists, if it does we return True, else we return False

Parameters

qr_code_key (str) – The unique identifier for each sample entry.

Returns

Boolean. True if key exists. False if key does not exist.

Return type

bool

5. get_strf_utc_time#

db_helper.get_strf_utc_date(input='')#

Creates a formatted string of the current utc time. If called with no parameters function will auto generate current utc date.

Parameters

input – The unique identifier for each sample entry.

Returns

converted datetime to string with "%m/%d/%Y" format

Return type

string
